title: Poisonous Plants Quiz
description: Beautiful but dangerous! Test your knowledge of toxic plants that can be found in gardens, fields, and forests.

questions.question: Which common garden flower has all parts toxic, especially the seeds, and was historically used as a heart medicine?
What poisonous plant was used to execute the philosopher Socrates in ancient Greece?
Which beautiful flowering shrub, common in warm climates, is toxic in all parts including the smoke from burning it?
Deadly Nightshade (Atropa belladonna) gets its name "belladonna" from what historical use?
options: Women used it to dilate pupils for beauty
It was named after a queen
It was used as a perfume

questions.question: Which common spring bulb flower is toxic if eaten, particularly the bulbs?
What three-leaved plant causes severe skin irritation through an oil called urushiol?
Which popular Christmas plant was long believed to be highly poisonous but is actually only mildly toxic?
Monkshood (Aconitum) is one of the most poisonous garden plants. What is it also called?
Which invasive plant can cause severe burns and blisters when its sap contacts skin exposed to sunlight?
The Castor Bean plant produces seeds that contain what extremely toxic substance?
Which common houseplant contains calcium oxalate crystals that cause mouth and throat irritation if chewed?
What beautiful but toxic plant has large trumpet-shaped flowers that hang downward?
Rhubarb is commonly eaten, but which part of the plant is poisonous?
Which shade-loving ground cover plant produces bright red berries that are toxic to humans?
Water Hemlock is considered the most toxic plant in North America. Where does it commonly grow?
options: In wet meadows and along streams
